subject: Re: [junit] Test Result capturing
msgSnippet: You could write your own test runner, why not? Start with open source code of jUnit and make what you want :) Test Result is kind of *console* for failures.
messageBody:
You could write your own test runner, why not? Start with open source code
of jUnit and make what you want :)
Test Result is kind of *console* for failures. You could freely get its
content and convert it to any representation you want, more over you could
use TestListner bounded to TestResult to get some events!
> I hope that u will help me in this case and send me a small
> program which illustrates how the print the Test Result other than
> using a Test Runner
jUnit is small enough :)

Alexander

----- Original Message -----
From: "Praveen G" <sujasree3@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 13, 2002 12:04 PM
Subject: [junit] Test Result capturing


> Hello junit friends
>
> I am devoloping a Unit Test tool which takes a '.class'
> file as input and gives a dynamic GUI for the collection of test
> data from the user at method level. This data is stored in XML and
> later i am using this XML file to genrerate a .java ,Junit
> framework compliant code. When the tests is run the .java file
> which internally uses the JUNIT Swing Runner is run.
> But my doubt is how to collect the Test Result other than a
> using a Test Runner. I also want to log the report to a file which
> will be useful for the future.
> I hope that u will help me in this case and send me a small
> program which illustrates how the print the Test Result other than
> using a Test Runner
>
> Thanks in advance
> Sujan Kumar
>
